summary: Robert James Dwyer is identified as a Special Agent (SA) of the FBI. The documents indicate his involvement in investigations related to individuals of interest, specifically in the context of Cuban exiles and their activities. He is mentioned in connection with investigations involving Pedro Luis Diaz Lanz, Renaldo Blanco Hernandez, and Alberto Eusebio Mojena, where he provided a report that was shared with the United States Customs Office in Miami. The documents suggest Dwyer's role was to gather and report information on these individuals, potentially related to their activities and connections.
significance: Robert James Dwyer's significance in the JFK assassination context is indirect. As an FBI Special Agent, he was involved in investigating individuals and activities related to Cuban exiles, some of whom may have had connections, direct or indirect, to events surrounding the assassination. His role was primarily investigative, gathering and reporting information on individuals of interest, and his reports were shared with other government agencies.
